title: Chambers of Xeric/Challenge Mode

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Chambers of Xeric's Challenge Mode is a Chambers of Xeric raid with increased difficulty. Apart from the Great Olm, all of the enemies' combat stats (including health) are increased by 50%, making them harder to kill.

content:
The Chambers of Xeric's Challenge Mode is a Chambers of Xeric raid with increased difficulty. Apart from the Great Olm, all of the enemies' combat stats (including health) are increased by 50%, making them harder to kill.

In order to attempt a Challenge Mode raid, party leaders must select the "Challenge Mode" box when forming a party.

Unlike the normal raid, Challenge Mode possesses all of the potential rooms. Like large sized raids, each floor is guaranteed a scavenger and resource room. All of the rooms are linear and use the same layout in each run; there is no variation like in normal mode.

  • Top level: Tekton, Jewelled Crabs, Scavenger beasts, Ice demon, Lizardman shamans, resource room
  • Middle level: Vanguards, Thieving room, Scavenger beasts, Vespula, resource room, Tightrope room
  • Lower level: Guardians, Vasa Nistirio, Scavenger beasts, Skeletal mystics, Muttadiles, resource room

Contents

  • 1 Strategy
    • 1.1 Top Level
    • 1.2 Middle Level
    • 1.3 Lower Level
    • 1.4 Great Olm
  • 2 Rewards
  • 3 Combat Achievements

Strategy[edit | edit source]

Unlike normal mode raids which require little to no preparation, Challenge Mode raids will require some preparation due to the enemies' increased combat stats, which will typically require bringing additional equipment as players will be prepping earlier than usual. In larger teams preparation can be done later on despite the increased stats due to overall DPS increasing.

Inventory, with melee equipped:

  • 1-dose potions as after Tekton and the ice demon, overload+ is used for the remaining rooms
  • No saradomin brews since all food will be made and supplied after shamans
  • Elder maul or inquisitor mace for Tekton (if not using scythe and inquisitor's set)
  • Ghrazi rapier for Vasa crystals and ranged Vanguard
  • Rune pouch with runes for Vengeance (no thralls) or for summoning thralls
    • Book of the dead required for thralls

Top Level[edit | edit source]

Prior to starting the raid, drink a dose of divine super combat and stamina for Tekton. Tekton is the first major roadblock as players will not have any access to Overload (+) since he is the first room in the floor. It will mostly come down to luck if the player's dragon warhammer specials will hit or not. Inquisitor's armour, an elder maul or Inquisitor's mace is highly encouraged to clear this room faster. Try to pick up at least one overload+ after he dies. If players are not using thralls, Vengeance can be used to rebound a decent amount of damage back to Tekton.

After Tekton dies, clear crabs as normal and deposit all items into the chest in the ice demon room. Backtrack one room to the scavengers and kill them until an ample supply of Endarkened juice, Stinkhorn mushrooms, at least two Mallignum root planks and a lockpick is obtained. Clear the next two rooms as normal until reaching the resource room. Prepare all additional supplies here as the layout of this resource room is more compact to minimise time getting materials.

Grab all combat equipment for the next room, the Vanguards.

Middle Level[edit | edit source]

Due to the increased Magic level of the melee Vanguard, it is recommended to target it first whenever possible as the other two Vanguards are still relatively easy to hit despite their increased stats. Vespula's room is a corner room and it is recommended to use the Redemption method to prevent her from setting off any lux grubs, which will significantly set the team back.

After clearing the tightrope room, make sure to grab a pickaxe, axe and salve amulet.

Lower Level[edit | edit source]

This level is considered the hardest of the three levels due to both Vasa and the muttadiles being significantly more dangerous in challenge mode compared to normal mode. Using Vengenance against Vasa's teleport attack can deal significant damage to him, but only when the player is not using thralls. Otherwise, use the melee or ranged thralls to assist in combat.

The muttadiles are the most dangerous demi-bosses as both of them can hit significantly hard through prayer, being capable of two-hitting players if they aren't protecting against their attacks. Unlike normal mode where standing next to the small muttadile is beneficial, it is recommended to tank the ranged and staying as far as possible whenever possible to minimise the chances of getting combo'ed out. As the larger muttadile is generally incapable of killing players while submerged unless their health is low, it is recommended to maximise ranged defence to reduce the chances of the smaller muttadile hitting. As such, use ranged or magic against the smaller muttadile.

The larger muttadile is dealt with normally as in normal mode, although players will need to keep their health higher due to the increased max hit.

Great Olm[edit | edit source]

Unlike the other monsters in challenge mode, Olm's hands and head do not have increased health, although they still retain the increased combat stats. This makes the right hand slightly harder to hit and it is recommended to maximise magic bonus and use magic thralls against it.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

While the loot players may receive from defeating the Great Olm in Challenge Mode is the same as that of a normal mode raid, the points a player will earn throughout the raid is much higher than normal which increases the quantity of commons and increases the chances of a unique item. In addition, completion count for the Chambers of Xeric's Challenge Mode is counted separately from the normal raid.

Players who complete the Challenge Mode raid within a set amount of time will have a chance of receiving a twisted ancestral colour kit. They will also have a 1/400 chance of receiving metamorphic dust, which can be used on an olmlet to allow it to metamorphose into Tektiny, Enraged Tektiny, Vespina, Flying Vespina, a Vanguard pet, a puppadile or Vasa Minirio. Only one metamorphic dust is required to obtain the ability to metamorphose an olmlet into all other five pets. If any additional metamorphic dusts are used on an olmlet, a game message will appear "You have already unlocked the metamorphosis ability for your pet". The kit and dust will be broadcasted in the game box should one roll, and both of them also have their own separate light shining on the chest.

In addition to having a chance at a twisted ancestral colour kit and metamorphic dust, completion of a Challenge Mode raid within the required time will also yield an additional 5,000 points per player for the total team points count, meaning the overall chance of obtaining a unique drop is increased should the team perform well.

The time required for both of these benefits are as follows:

Number of players Completion time required
1 1 hour 10 minutes
2 1 hour 5 minutes
3 50 minutes
4 45 minutes
5-10 42 minutes
11-15 45 minutes
16-23 1 hour
24+ 1 hour 20 minutes

In addition, completing a certain number of Challenge Mode raids will grant players certain capes by speaking to Captain Rimor by the Chamber's entrance. The overall designs of the capes will have more elements added to them as players continue to complete more Challenge Mode raids.

Cape Completion count required
Xeric's guard 100
Xeric's warrior 500
Xeric's sentinel 1,000
Xeric's general 1,500
Xeric's champion 2,000

A score board can be found outside the entrance to the chambers listing the bests of the current world in addition to a global best. This scoreboard is manually updated each time the game is introduced for team sizes.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve the Chambers of Xeric: Challenge Mode.

Name Description Difficulty Category
Dust Seeker Complete a Chambers of Xeric Challenge mode raid in the target time. Elite Speed
Chambers of Xeric: CM Master Complete the Chambers of Xeric: Challenge Mode 50 times. Master Kill count
Immortal Raid Team Complete a Chambers of Xeric: Challenge mode raid without anyone dying. Master Perfection
Immortal Raider Complete a Chambers of Xeric Challenge mode (Solo) raid without dying. Master Perfection
Chambers of Xeric: CM (Solo) Speed-Chaser Complete a Chambers of Xeric: Challenge Mode (Solo) in less than 45 minutes. Master Speed
Chambers of Xeric: CM (5-Scale) Speed-Chaser Complete a Chambers of Xeric: Challenge Mode (5-scale) in less than 30 minutes. Master Speed
Chambers of Xeric: CM (Trio) Speed-Chaser Complete a Chambers of Xeric: Challenge Mode (Trio) in less than 35 minutes. Master Speed
Chambers of Xeric: CM Grandmaster Complete the Chambers of Xeric: Challenge Mode 150 times. Grandmaster Kill count
Chambers of Xeric: CM (Solo) Speed-Runner Complete a Chambers of Xeric: Challenge Mode (Solo) in less than 38 minutes and 30 seconds. Grandmaster Speed
Chambers of Xeric: CM (5-Scale) Speed-Runner Complete a Chambers of Xeric: Challenge Mode (5-scale) in less than 25 minutes. Grandmaster Speed
Chambers of Xeric: CM (Trio) Speed-Runner Complete a Chambers of Xeric: Challenge Mode (Trio) in less than 27 minutes. Grandmaster Speed

rawContent:
[[File:Chambers of Xeric Challenge Mode icon.png|left]]
The Chambers of Xeric's '''Challenge Mode''' is a Chambers of Xeric raid with increased difficulty. Apart from the [[Great Olm]], all of the enemies' combat stats (including health) are increased by 50%, making them harder to kill.

In order to attempt a Challenge Mode raid, party leaders must select the "Challenge Mode" box when forming a party.

Unlike the normal raid, Challenge Mode possesses all of the potential rooms. Like large sized raids, each floor is guaranteed a scavenger and resource room. All of the rooms are linear and use the same layout in each run; there is no variation like in normal mode.

*Top level: [[Tekton]], [[Jewelled Crab]]s, [[Scavenger beast]]s, [[Ice demon]], [[Lizardman shaman (Chambers of Xeric)|Lizardman shamans]], resource room
*Middle level: [[Vanguard]]s, [[Corrupted scavenger|Thieving room]], [[Scavenger beast]]s, [[Vespula]], resource room, [[Chambers of Xeric/Strategies#Tightrope|Tightrope room]]
*Lower level: [[Guardian (Chambers of Xeric)|Guardians]], [[Vasa Nistirio]], [[Scavenger beast]]s, [[Skeletal mystic]]s, [[Muttadile]]s, resource room

==Strategy==
Unlike normal mode raids which require little to no preparation, Challenge Mode raids will require some preparation due to the enemies' increased combat stats, which will typically require bringing additional equipment as players will be prepping earlier than usual. In larger teams preparation can be done later on despite the increased stats due to overall DPS increasing.

{{Inventory|align=right
|Ancestral robe top | Sanguinesti staff| Super combat potion(1) | Ranging potion(1)
|Ancestral robe bottom | Arcane spirit shield | Sanfew serum(4) | Super restore(4)
|Occult necklace | Tormented bracelet | Stamina potion(4) | Ava's assembler 
|Armadyl chestplate | Twisted bow | Ghrazi rapier | Stamina potion(4)
|Armadyl chainskirt | Necklace of anguish | Elder maul | Stamina potion(4)
|Dragon warhammer | Crystal pickaxe | Stamina potion(4) | Stamina potion(4)
|Rune pouch | Salve amulet(ei) | Book of the dead | Imbued saradomin cape
}}

Inventory, with melee equipped:

*1-dose potions as after Tekton and the [[ice demon]], overload+ is used for the remaining rooms
*No saradomin brews since all food will be made and supplied after shamans
*Elder maul or [[inquisitor mace]] for Tekton (if not using scythe and inquisitor's set)
*Ghrazi rapier for Vasa crystals and ranged Vanguard
*Rune pouch with runes for [[Vengeance]] (no thralls) or for summoning thralls
**Book of the dead required for thralls

===Top Level===
Prior to starting the raid, drink a dose of divine super combat and stamina for [[Tekton]]. Tekton is the first major roadblock as players will not have any access to [[Overload (+)]] since he is the first room in the floor. It will mostly come down to luck if the player's [[dragon warhammer]] specials will hit or not. [[Inquisitor's armour]], an [[elder maul]] or [[Inquisitor's mace]] is highly encouraged to clear this room faster. Try to pick up at least one overload+ after he dies. If players are not using thralls, [[Vengeance]] can be used to rebound a decent amount of damage back to Tekton.

After Tekton dies, clear crabs as normal and deposit all items into the chest in the ice demon room. Backtrack one room to the scavengers and kill them until an ample supply of [[Endarkened juice]], [[Stinkhorn mushroom]]s, at least two [[Mallignum root plank]]s and a [[lockpick]] is obtained. Clear the next two rooms as normal until reaching the resource room. '''Prepare all additional supplies here''' as the layout of this resource room is more compact to minimise time getting materials.

Grab all combat equipment for the next room, the Vanguards.

===Middle Level===
Due to the increased Magic level of the melee Vanguard, it is recommended to target it first whenever possible as the other two Vanguards are still relatively easy to hit despite their increased stats. Vespula's room is a corner room and it is recommended to use the Redemption method to prevent her from setting off any lux grubs, which will significantly set the team back.

After clearing the tightrope room, make sure to grab a pickaxe, axe and salve amulet.

===Lower Level===
This level is considered the hardest of the three levels due to both Vasa and the muttadiles being significantly more dangerous in challenge mode compared to normal mode. Using Vengenance against Vasa's teleport attack can deal significant damage to him, but only when the player is not using thralls. Otherwise, use the melee or ranged thralls to assist in combat.

The muttadiles are the most dangerous demi-bosses as both of them can hit significantly hard through prayer, being capable of two-hitting players if they aren't protecting against their attacks. Unlike normal mode where standing next to the small muttadile is beneficial, it is recommended to tank the ranged and staying as far as possible whenever possible to minimise the chances of getting combo'ed out. As the larger muttadile is generally incapable of killing players while submerged unless their health is low, it is recommended to maximise ranged defence to reduce the chances of the smaller muttadile hitting. As such, use ranged or magic against the smaller muttadile.

The larger muttadile is dealt with normally as in normal mode, although players will need to keep their health higher due to the increased max hit.

===Great Olm===
Unlike the other monsters in challenge mode, Olm's hands and head do not have increased health, although they still retain the increased combat stats. This makes the right hand slightly harder to hit and it is recommended to maximise magic bonus and use magic thralls against it.

==Rewards==
While the loot players may receive from defeating the [[Great Olm]] in Challenge Mode is the same as that of a normal mode raid, the points a player will earn throughout the raid is much higher than normal which increases the quantity of commons and increases the chances of a unique item. In addition, completion count for the Chambers of Xeric's Challenge Mode is counted separately from the normal raid.

Players who complete the Challenge Mode raid within a set amount of time will have a chance of receiving a [[twisted ancestral colour kit]]. They will also have a 1/400 chance of receiving [[metamorphic dust]], which can be used on an [[olmlet]] to allow it to metamorphose into Tektiny, Enraged Tektiny, Vespina, Flying Vespina, a Vanguard pet, a puppadile or Vasa Minirio. Only one metamorphic dust is required to obtain the ability to metamorphose an olmlet into all other five pets. If any additional metamorphic dusts are used on an olmlet, a game message will appear "You have already unlocked the metamorphosis ability for your pet". The kit and dust will be broadcasted in the game box should one roll, and both of them also have their own separate light shining on the chest.

In addition to having a chance at a twisted ancestral colour kit and metamorphic dust, completion of a Challenge Mode raid within the required time will also yield an additional 5,000 points per player for the total team points count, meaning the overall chance of obtaining a unique drop is increased should the team perform well.

The time required for both of these benefits are as follows:

A score board can be found outside the entrance to the chambers listing the bests of the current world in addition to a global best. This scoreboard is manually updated each time the game is introduced for team sizes.
